gurmukhi: iBVXo ByV BUpM iJxXo JyV JwVM ]
transliteration: Bhidyo Bhed Bhoopan Jhinyo Jhed Jhaadan||
translation: He quarreled with the king and in the strife felt offended;

gurmukhi: mhw kRoD auTXo qxI qyV qwVM ]7]175]
translation: And rose in great anger, breaking the strings of his clothes.7.175.

gurmukhi: qjXo srp myDM BjXo eyk nwQM ]
transliteration: Tajyo Sarap Medhan Bhajyo Ek Naathan||
translation: He asked the king to forsake the serpent-sacrifice and meditate on the One Lord;

gurmukhi: kiRpw mMqR sUJY sBY siRst swjM ]
transliteration: Kridaa Mantra Soojhai Sabhai Srist Saajan||
translation: With whose Grace all the mantras and materials of the world come to our mind.
“O the Lion-like monarch and the treasure of learning!
“Thy Glory will shine like sun and blaze like fire.8.176.

gurmukhi: mhI mwh rUpM qpY qyj BwnM ]
translation: “Thy beauty on the earth shall be moonlike and thy splendour sunlike;
“Thou shall be treasure of fourteen learnings.
“Listen, O wielder of the bow and the monarch with knowledge of the Shastras!

gurmukhi: qjhu srp myDM idjY moih dwnM ]9]177]
transliteration: Tajoh Sarap Medhan Dijai Moh(i) Daapan||
translation: “Bestow on me this gifts of abandoning the serpents-sacrifice.9.177.

gurmukhi: qjhu jon srpM jrO Agn AwpM ]
transliteration: Tajoh Jon Sarapan Jarau Agad Aapan||
translation: “If thou dost not abandon this gift of abandoning the serpent-sacrifice, I shall burn myself in the fire;

gurmukhi: krO dgD qo kO idvO AYs sRwpM ]
transliteration: Karau Dagadh To Kau Divau Ais Sraapan||
translation: “Or by giving such curse I shall reduce thee to ashes;
“Or I shall pierce my belly with the sharp dagger;

gurmukhi: lgY pwp qo kO sunhu rwj gwVM ]10]178]
transliteration: Lagad Paap To Kau Sounoh Raaj Gaddan||10||178||
translation: “Listen! O king ! thou shalt be causing a great sin for thyself of Brahmin-killing.”10.178.
